paper.title: Phase-curve Evidence for an Atmosphere on TRAPPIST-1 b

core_question: The study investigates whether the Earth-sized rocky exoplanet TRAPPIST-1 b retains an atmosphere despite strong stellar irradiation.

datasets_or_cohorts.label: JWST MIRI Phase Curve
datasets_or_cohorts.description: JWST MIRI low-resolution spectroscopy over an orbital phase curve measuring thermal phase variation and spectral structure.

datasets_or_cohorts.label: Atmospheric Retrieval Models
datasets_or_cohorts.description: Comparison of null (bare-rock), CO2-rich atmosphere, and O2-rich atmosphere scenarios against the observed data.

major_limitations: Single-planet study does not prove atmospheric prevalence for all M-dwarf rocky planets.
Retrieval assumptions like circulation and cloud treatment affect quantitative posteriors.
Stellar variability and instrument systematics can bias weak spectral features.
Night-side constraints are weaker than day-side constraints in the current dataset.
